column5: I completely understand where your coming from. And I thank everyone for there opinions. I've been fishing Cook's for 5 years now (with a potable), but have never had to worry about this much weight. And its not just my safety that I'm worried about.
Check out the weather for Innisfil... very cold or the next few days and then Monday kind of scares me.   http://www.theweathernetwork.com/weather/caon0320
Braggart......

My buddy and myself hit Gilford yesterday, Walked out into the fog, first hole we drilled we stayed there all day with non stop bite, 18'FTW. You couldn't get your jig to the bottom before you had a fish on, it was crazy, was like that all day. My lure of choice was a micro white jig with a Perch eye. You could tease them right up into the hole. We must have filter threw hundreds to get any decent keepers. We found that fishing about 6' below the ice you could pull your jig away from the dinks to get the bigger ones. I brought around 30 home and my buddy maybe 40. It rained most of the day out there. When we left, the water was going down the hole like a toilet bowl. Ice were we fished was 6". I hope the ice holds, because it was melting fast. As we packed up, one guy came by that was lost asked which way is Gilford,   good thing I had my GPS because he was heading in the opposite direction.   The fog was so bad you couldn't see. Be careful out there guys. Now I got to get to work
Nice going.I went to the boat show. I should of went fishing
nice haul, its a bonus when you only have to drill once
Gotta love the water going down the hole like a toilet bowl  Great haul there and yes, do hope the ice holds.  With the temps this morning, should be okay!  Enjoy your snacks
The 1.5ft of snow we got in Barrie lastnight might have an effect on the ice.
Nice haul!!  Hope the the bite is as good this weekend.
Nice haul! I can't wait to get onto Simcoe myself!
Nice haul bud.   South of Innisfil Beach RD Bill,nadda. Mrs,s drove on clear rds from there to work.
Nice sink-o-perch you got there.
Sweet!  Looks like I'll be out for lakers in the near future
You've hit the jackpot Fish Farmer... nice haul Got to love being able to weed thru the small ones to get to the keepers
Thank you very much for the proper directions home, i was the guy wandering in the fog. Scott
lots of quads and sleds out?  On sunday there were some sleds ripping the shoreline near keswick and a couple quads WAY out there...
Good job Dave!!
Sweet catch FF.  What a great way to spend the day, especially when it's all fresh and just getting started.  A lot more trips to looks forward to I'm sure.  That's the best part.  Good job!

Thanks everyone   The only down side fishnsled is the parking on the weekends  No broblem Scott, glad to help because I've been in the same spot.   My buddy that was with me has a GPS and has never taken it out of the box. After he seen the fog, he said he was going home and learning how to use his. You opened his eye's.  Hope we meet up again.   We saw 1 ATV, that was it. I don't think I'd be running around out there yet on a machine. But each his own. Not a far walk anyway. Just be careful.
NICE.......I always look forward to the "FARM REPORT"....
How much ice was there?
Should be enough now with the cold nights. When we left it was raining and melting, but it got cold that night. We had about 6" where we were. Just be careful.
Enough to bring a hut out with a snowmobile? Hut that weighs 800 to 1000 lbs?
LOL

Well first you should need to know the overall foot print of said hut....then calculate the foot print into foot pounds per square foot...then you must find the density of said ice and divide that into square inches to find the square root of said ice....with all those numbers figured in I still would have no idea....LOL..... but PLEASE be careful on the ice.  Bob
Enough to bring a hut out with a snowmobile? Hut that weighs 800 to 1000 lbs?
LTF  You have a PM  Rick

LTF, For me to say OK, I won't. I don't think anyone would give the OK, if anything happened they would feel responsible. I see on the other simcoe sites that operators are taking their huts out but how far??? and where exactly???? and heavy????. Sorry I can't say. Good luck Fishing Bud and Like I said be careful. I want to see your fish reports,   not your name in the Obits.
